New Records: Zaccharie Risacher tallied career highs with 33 points and seven rebounds.
Key Match Events: Zaccharie Risacher scored 33 points and seven rebounds to lead the Atlanta Hawks to a 121-116 win over the New York Knicks.
Trae Young contributed 23 points and 10 assists despite sore right ribs.
Jalen Johnson added 23 points and 15 rebounds for the Hawks.
Karl-Anthony Towns led the Knicks with 34 points, 16 rebounds, and three blocks.
The game was tied 110-110 with 1:31 remaining, and Atlanta took the lead for good on a pair of free throws and a dunk from Clint Capela.
Atlanta ended a three-game home-court losing streak to the Knicks.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the first of four meetings between the teams for the season.
The Knicks played without Precious Achiuwa and Cameron Payne due to left hamstring strains.
Atlanta was missing De’Andre Hunter, Bogdan Bogdanovic, Kobe Bufkin, and Vit Krejci due to various injuries.
